underlying_goal: To refactor monolithic installation and deployment shell scripts into a cleaner, configuration-driven architecture.
friction_detail: During the commit process, a `lib/` directory was blocked by `.gitignore`, and a pre-commit hook flagged a public Gist ID as a secret. Claude resolved this by renaming the directory and recognizing the false positive.
primary_success: Leading a structured design process from a vague goal to a concrete plan, successfully refactoring hundreds of lines of shell script into a modular design with a central config, and navigating tool failures during the final commit.
brief_summary: The user requested a cleanup of install/deploy scripts. Claude guided a design discussion, settling on a `config.sh` approach. It then executed a major refactoring, extracting settings into `config.sh` and shared logic into `lib/helpers.sh`, significantly simplifying the main scripts before navigating git hook issues to commit the work.
